page.title: 12Water Supply /Sewage System.
page.content: Two herringbone drain systems lie under the surface by the Cattle Shelter and by the Quarters.Water is pumped from these field drains to tanks at the north of the village and pumped on to the houses.At present the water is not treated and is somewhat brown - with a peaty taste.A water treatment plant will probably be installed in the future. There are filters in all the houses but most residents drink the water unfiltered and seem to suffer no ill effects.Only Tibbets is not on the system and it manages on roof water. Water can run low in dry spells and visitors are then asked to use water sparingly. Sewage runs to a digesting system at the bottom of Milcombe Valley.
